newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy offers 13.0 trln lire bonds, certificates.
newsitem.headline: Italy offers 13.0 trln lire bonds, certificates.

text.p: The Italian Treasury said on Monday it would issue a total of 13.0 trillion lire of medium to long-term paper for sale at its regular end-month auction.
The Treasury said in a statement said it would offer:
* 2.5 trillion lire of three-year fixed rate bonds (BTP) paying a 6.0 percent coupon.
* 2.5 trillion lire of five-year 6.25 percent BTPs
* 4.5 trillion lire of 7-year floating rate certificates (CCTs) paying an initial 3.45 percent coupon.
Subscriptions for the CCT, 10-year and 30-year BTP auctions close at 1200 GMT on February 27.
Subscriptions for the three and five year BTP auctions close at 1200 GMT on February 28.
